definitions: temporary barrier built across a street or entrance to block passage
defensive fortification made of available materials to protect against attack
examples: Police set up barricades to control the crowd
The protesters moved the barricades aside to march
Rebels built barricades from overturned cars and debris
The soldiers took cover behind makeshift barricades

definitions: Spanish-speaking quarter or neighborhood in a city, especially in the southwestern United States
examples: She grew up in the barrio of East Los Angeles
The barrio celebrates its cultural heritage every September

definitions: lawyer qualified to argue cases in higher courts, especially in British legal systems
examples: The barrister presented compelling evidence to the jury
She hired an experienced barrister for her appeal case

definitions: small cart with wheels for carrying loads by hand
prehistoric mound of earth or stones placed over a burial site
examples: The gardener pushed the barrow full of compost
Workers used barrows to move construction materials
Archaeologists excavated the Bronze Age barrow carefully
The ancient barrow contained valuable artifacts and remains

definitions: person who mixes and serves alcoholic drinks at a bar
examples: The bartender recommended their signature cocktail special
She worked as a bartender during college years

definitions: system of exchange where goods or services are directly traded without using money
examples: Ancient civilizations relied on barter before currency existed
They used barter to trade vegetables for fresh eggs

definitions: dark fine-grained volcanic rock formed from rapidly cooled lava
examples: The island's beaches contain black basalt sand particles
Ancient builders used basalt blocks for temple construction

definitions: minimum or starting point used for comparisons or measurements
back boundary line at each end of a tennis court
examples: Scientists established a baseline for measuring climate change
The study used 2020 data as its baseline
The player served from behind the baseline perfectly
She hit a powerful shot from the baseline

definitions: forceful hit or strike that causes damage
informal celebration or party with many guests
examples: The bash from the hammer dented the metal
He gave the door a hard bash to open it
They threw a birthday bash at the beach house
The company's annual bash attracted hundreds of employees

definitions: fragrant green herb commonly used in Mediterranean and Asian cooking
examples: Fresh basil adds wonderful flavor to tomato sauce
She grows several varieties of basil in her garden

definitions: large important church building with special ceremonial rights, often featuring a distinctive architectural style
examples: Pilgrims traveled to visit the ancient basilica in Rome
The basilica's dome dominated the city's skyline magnificently

definitions: legendary reptile whose gaze or breath could kill
small tropical American lizard that can run on water
examples: Medieval texts describe the basilisk as a deadly creature
The basilisk appears in many fantasy novels and games
The green basilisk ran across the pond's surface
Basilisk lizards are sometimes called Jesus Christ lizards

definitions: wide round container for holding liquids or washing
natural depression in earth's surface that collects water
examples: She filled the basin with warm soapy water
The ceramic basin cracked after years of use
The Amazon basin covers several South American countries
Rivers flow into the basin from surrounding mountains

definitions: art or craft of making baskets and other objects by weaving flexible materials
examples: Indigenous basketry techniques have been passed down generations
She learned basketry using willow branches and reeds

definitions: musician who plays the bass guitar or double bass instrument
examples: The band's bassist laid down a funky groove
She worked as a session bassist for recording studios

definitions: large double-reed woodwind instrument with a deep rich tone
examples: The bassoon provides depth to the orchestra's sound
Learning bassoon requires strong breath control and patience

definitions: North American tree with soft pale wood used for carving and furniture
examples: Carvers prefer basswood for its fine grain texture
The basswood tree provides shade with heart-shaped leaves

definitions: projecting part of a fortification built for defensive purposes
institution or place strongly defending particular principles or activities
examples: Soldiers defended the bastion against enemy attacks fiercely
The old bastion still stands overlooking the harbor
The university remains a bastion of academic freedom
This newspaper is the last bastion of investigative journalism

definitions: quantity of things produced or dealt with as a single unit or group
examples: The bakery made a fresh batch of cookies daily
She processed the documents in batches of twenty

definitions: building containing baths or swimming facilities for public use
examples: The Roman bathhouse ruins reveal ancient bathing customs
The spa's bathhouse offers various therapeutic water treatments

definitions: act of washing one's body in a bath or shower
activity of swimming or spending time in water for pleasure
examples: Daily bathing helps maintain good personal hygiene habits
The doctor recommended warm bathing for muscle relaxation
Beach bathing is popular during the summer months
No bathing allowed when the red flag is raised

definitions: large container for water in which a person sits to wash their body
examples: The antique bathtub had decorative claw feet underneath
She filled the bathtub with bubbles and hot water

definitions: method of dyeing fabric using wax to create patterns and designs
examples: Indonesian batik features intricate patterns and vibrant colors
She learned batik techniques during her travels abroad

definitions: thin stick used by a conductor to direct an orchestra
short stick passed between runners in a relay race
examples: The conductor raised her baton to begin the symphony
His precise baton movements guided the orchestra perfectly
The runner dropped the baton during the crucial exchange
Each team member must pass the baton smoothly

definitions: player whose turn it is to bat in cricket
examples: The batsman scored a century in today's match
An experienced batsman knows how to read the bowler

definitions: large body of troops ready for battle, typically consisting of several companies
examples: The battalion prepared for deployment to the region
Each battalion contains approximately eight hundred soldiers

definitions: thin strip of wood used in building construction
device for securing or fastening something in place
examples: Carpenters nailed battens to create the wall framework
The roof battens support the tiles above them
Sailors used battens to secure the cargo hatches
Storm battens kept the shutters firmly closed

definitions: player who is batting in baseball or cricket
mixture of flour, eggs, and liquid used in cooking
examples: The batter stepped up to the plate confidently
Each batter gets three strikes before being out
She whisked the pancake batter until completely smooth
The fish batter creates a crispy golden coating

definitions: continuous violent striking or pounding against something
examples: The battering of waves eroded the cliff face
Years of battering left the old door badly damaged

definitions: action or skill of hitting with a bat in sports
sheets of cotton or synthetic material used for padding
examples: His batting average improved significantly this season
The team practiced batting techniques every morning
Quilters use batting between fabric layers for warmth
She bought polyester batting for the blanket project

definitions: piece of ground on which a battle is or was fought
examples: Historians preserved the Civil War battlefield as a memorial
The battlefield stretched across miles of open countryside

definitions: foremost line of an army engaged in battle or military conflict
examples: Supplies were urgently needed at the battlefront positions
Reporters rarely gained access to the actual battlefront

definitions: place where a battle is fought or area of serious disagreement or conflict
examples: The valley became a battleground between opposing forces
Social media has become a battleground for political ideas

definitions: person who fights hard and persistently despite difficulties
examples: She was a real battler who never gave up
The team's battlers pushed through despite the odds

definitions: large heavily armored warship with powerful guns for naval warfare
examples: The battleship's guns could hit targets miles away
Museums preserve historic battleships for public viewing

definitions: reddish-brown rock that is the main source of aluminum
examples: Mining companies extract bauxite from open pit mines
Australia produces large quantities of bauxite annually

definitions: blade that can be fixed to the end of a rifle for hand-to-hand fighting
examples: Soldiers trained with bayonets for close combat situations
The antique bayonet was displayed in the museum

definitions: marshy outlet of a lake or river found in flat low-lying areas
examples: Alligators inhabit the quiet waters of the bayou
The bayou winds through miles of Louisiana swampland

definitions: market in Middle Eastern countries with rows of shops and stalls
sale of goods to raise money for charity
examples: Tourists love exploring the colorful bazaar in Istanbul
The bazaar sells everything from spices to handmade carpets
The church bazaar raised funds for community programs
She donated handmade crafts to the annual bazaar

definitions: portable shoulder-fired rocket launcher used against tanks and fortifications
examples: Infantry carried bazookas during World War Two battles
The bazooka could penetrate thick armor at close range

definitions: land or property directly facing or adjacent to a beach
examples: Beachfront hotels command premium prices during summer season
They bought beachfront property for their retirement home

definitions: defended position on a beach taken from an enemy by landing forces
examples: Allied forces established a beachhead on D-Day morning
The marines secured the beachhead despite heavy resistance

definitions: fire or light set up to guide or warn
person or thing that inspires or guides others
examples: The lighthouse beacon warned ships of dangerous rocks
Airport beacons help pilots navigate in poor visibility
She became a beacon of hope for struggling students
The organization serves as a beacon for human rights

definitions: small piece of glass, stone, or similar material for threading
small drop of liquid on a surface
examples: She strung colorful beads to make a necklace
The rosary contains fifty-nine prayer beads total
Beads of sweat formed on his forehead quickly
Morning dew created tiny beads on spider webs

definitions: decorative work made by sewing or threading beads onto fabric or other materials
examples: Native American beadwork displays intricate traditional patterns
Her beadwork adorned ceremonial clothing and accessories
